revised_title: The Assimilation of Carbon by Green Plants from Certain Organic Compounds
tldr: The author investigates the ability of green plants to assimilate carbon from various organic compounds and finds that they can only form starch from carbohydrates or closely related bodies, not from aldehydes or their derivatives. The study also reveals that plants have largely lost the ability to use organic compounds as a carbon source due to their normal process of obtaining carbon from CO2.
